title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/phylocomr.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version phylocomr ropensci/phylocomr) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/phylocomr.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/phylocomr

title: Introduction to the phylocomr package
text: Install ape examples: Stable phylocomr version CRAN , development version Github
code: install.packages('ape') install.packages("phylocomr") devtools::install_github("ropensci/phylocomr") library("phylocomr")

title: Introduction to the phylocomr package
code: taxa_file <- system.file("examples/taxa", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo", package = "phylocomr") (taxa_str <- readLines(taxa_file)) (phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file)) ph_phylomatic(taxa = taxa_str, phylo = phylo_str)

title: Introduction to the phylocomr package
code: traits_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_aot", package = "phylocomr") traitsdf_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot_df", package = "phylocomr") traits <- read.table(text = readLines(traitsdf_file), header = TRUE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) ph_aot(traits = traits, phylo = phylo_str)

title: Introduction to the phylocomr package
text: plot
code: ages_file <- system.file("examples/ages", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_bladj", package = "phylocomr") ages_df <- data.frame(   a = c('malpighiales','salicaceae','fabaceae','rosales','oleaceae',         'gentianales','apocynaceae','rubiaceae'),   b = c(81,20,56,76,47,71,18,56) ) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) res <- ph_bladj(ages = ages_df, phylo = phylo_str)  if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   plot(read.tree(text = res)) }

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ooms J, Chamberlain S, Sanchez Reyes L (2024). phylocomr: Interface 'Phylocom'. R package version 0.3.4, https://github.com/ropensci/phylocomr, https://docs.ropensci.org/phylocomr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {phylocomr: Interface to 'Phylocom'},   author = {Jeroen Ooms and Scott Chamberlain and Luna Luisa {Sanchez Reyes}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.4, https://github.com/ropensci/phylocomr},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/phylocomr/}, }

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: phylocomr gives access Phylocom C library, licensed BSD 2-clause

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: ecovolve/ph_ecovolve - interface ecovolve executable, higher level interface phylomatic/ph_phylomatic - interface phylomatic executable, higher level interface phylocom - interface phylocom executable ph_aot - higher level interface aot ph_bladj - higher level interface bladj ph_comdist/ph_comdistnt - higher level interface comdist ph_comstruct - higher level interface comstruct ph_comtrait - higher level interface comtrait ph_pd - higher level interface Faith’s phylogenetic diversity

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: convenience can pass ages, sample trait data.frame’s, phylogenies strings, phylocomr functions. However, phylocomr write data.frame’s/strings disk (computer’s file system) able run Phylocom code . Internally, phylocomr writing temporary file run Phylocom code, file removed. addition, can pass files instead data.frame’s/strings. used. Instead, read write files temporary files. two reasons. First, Phylocom expects files using directory, control file paths becomes easier. Second, Phylocom case sensitive, simply standardize taxon names lower casing . case manipulation temporary files original data files modified.

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: Stable version: Development version:
code: install.packages("phylocomr") remotes::install_github("ropensci/phylocomr")  library("phylocomr") library("ape")

title: Interface to Phylocom
code: ph_ecovolve(speciation = 0.05, extinction = 0.005, time_units = 50)

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: use various different references trees

title: Interface to Phylocom
code: traits_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_aot", package = "phylocomr") traitsdf_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot_df", package = "phylocomr") traits <- read.table(text = readLines(traitsdf_file), header = TRUE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) ph_aot(traits = traits, phylo = phylo_str)  #> $trait_conservatism #> # title: Interface to Phylocom
code: ages_file <- system.file("examples/ages", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_bladj", package = "phylocomr") ages_df <- data.frame(   a = c('malpighiales','salicaceae','fabaceae','rosales','oleaceae',         'gentianales','apocynaceae','rubiaceae'),   b = c(81,20,56,76,47,71,18,56) ) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) (res <- ph_bladj(ages = ages_df, phylo = phylo_str))  #> [1] "((((((lomatium_concinnum:20.250000,campanula_vandesii:20.250000):20.250000,(((veronica_candidissima:10.125000,penstemon_paniculatus:10.125000)plantaginaceae:10.125000,justicia_oblonga:20.250000):10.125000,marsdenia_gilgiana:30.375000):10.125000):10.125000,epacris_alba-compacta:50.625000)ericales_to_asterales:10.125000,((daphne_anhuiensis:20.250000,syzygium_cumini:20.250000)malvids:20.250000,ditaxis_clariana:40.500000):20.250000):10.125000,thalictrum_setulosum:70.875000)eudicots:10.125000,((dendrocalamus_giganteus:27.000000,guzmania_densiflora:27.000000)poales:27.000000,warczewiczella_digitata:54.000000):27.000000)malpighiales:1.000000;\n" #> attr(,"ages_file") #> [1] "/var/folders/ss/2tpkp325521_kfgn59g44vd80000gn/T//RtmpeMkOMc/ages" #> attr(,"phylo_file") #> [1] "/var/folders/ss/2tpkp325521_kfgn59g44vd80000gn/T//RtmpeMkOMc/phylo_577376efe8a"  plot(ape::read.tree(text = res))

title: Interface to Phylocom
text: Please report issues bugs. License: MIT Get citation information phylocomr R citation(package = 'phylocomr') Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Executables — executables
text: Executables

title: Executables — executables
code: ecovolve(args = "--help", intern = FALSE)  phylocom(args = "help", intern = FALSE)  phylomatic(args = "--help", intern = FALSE)

title: Executables — executables
text: args character vector arguments command. intern capture output character vector. Default: FALSE

title: Executables — executables
code: ecovolve() #>  #>     ====================================================== #>  #>                        E C O V O L V E #>     PHYLOGENY AND TRAIT SIMULATOR WITH ECOLOGICAL PROCESSES #>                 Cam Webb <campbell.webb@yale.edu> #>  #>     ====================================================== #>  #> Usage: ecovolve [-s -e -t -m -c -p -l -d -h] #>  #> Switches: #>   -s    prob of speciation per unit time[0.05] #>   -e    prob of extinction per unit time[0.01] #>   -t    time units to simulate over [100] #>   -m    output mode (2 = LTT; 3 = newick) [3] #>   -c    prob envelope for char change, string of 10 ints [3211000000] #>   -l    stop simulation after this number of extant lineages [NO] #>   -p    output phylogeny pruned only for extant taxa [NO] #>   -d    taper character change by exp(-time / INT ) #>   -x    simulate competition, with trait proximity increasing extinction #>   -h    help #>  #> View it!: #>   $ ecovolve > ecovolve.phylo #>   $ phylocom makenex -f ecovolve.phylo -t ecovolve.traits \ #>              -s ecovolve.sample > ecovolve.nex #>   (open and trace character in Mesquite with BLs proportional) #>  phylocom() #>  #>   ========================================================== #>  #>                        P H Y L O C O M #>         PHYLOGENETIC ANALYSIS OF ECOLOGICAL COMMUNITIES #>           AND SPECIES TRAITS, WITH PHYLOGENETIC TOOLS #>                 Cam Webb <cwebb@oeb.harvard.edu>, #>                 David Ackerly <dackerly@berkeley.edu>, #>                 Steve Kembel <skembel@uoregon.edu> #>  #>   ========================================================== #>  #>   Version 4.2.  Copyright (c) 2001-2009 Webb, Ackerly and Kembel #>   This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.  This is free software, #>   and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; #>   type `phylocom license' for warranty, license and citation information. #>  #> Usage: phylocom method [ options ] #>  #> Phylogenetic community structure (intrasample): #>   comstruct: Calculates mean phylogenetic distance and mean nearest #>             taxon phylogenetic distance for each plot and all plots, and #>             compares them to [999] random runs with matrices created by #>             the null model specified by the -m switch. #>             Alter # runs with a second argument. #>   swap:     Swaps the input matrix 1000 times using the Independent Swap #>             Algorithm (independent swap) and outputs swapped matrix console. #>   pd:       Faith's Phylogenetic diversity; proportion of total branch length. #>   ltt:      Prints the number of lineages at fixed divs of total time #>             proportional to no. of tip taxa.  Phylo must be #>             ultrametric. [lttr compares with random samples.] #>   nodesig:  Tests each node for overabundance of terminal taxa. #>   nodesigl: As nodesig, but output in table form. #>  #> Phylogenetic community structure (intersample): #>   comdist:  Outputs the pairwise distance matrix between plots, based on mean #>             phylogenetic distance of all possible pairs of taxa in one plot #>             to the taxa in the other. [comdistnt uses nearest taxon method.] #>   icomdist: Gives the mean distance from each taxon to taxa in other plots. #>   rao     : Calculates Rao's entropy measure #>  #> Community trait structure: #>   comtrait: Measures of trait value clustering and evenness within samples #>  #> Phylogenetic trait analysis: #>   aot:      Trait analysis algorithms of David Ackerly #>   aotn:     Trait analysis algorithms (Nexus output) #>   aotf:     Trait analysis algorithms (full output) #>  #> Misc Phylogeny Tools: #>   phydist:  Calculates the simple pairwise matrix of phylogenetic distances. #>   phyvar:   Output phylogenetic variance-covariance matrix. #>   agenode:  Output the ages of each node, calculated from BLs. #>   ageterm:  Output the stem age of terminal taxon. #>   makenex:  Convert all data files into a Mesquite-readable Nexus #>   naf:      Convert all data files into a node-as-factor table #>   new2nex:  Convert the phylo file into a Mesquite-readable Nexus #>   new2fy:   Convert the phylo file into a tabular list of nodes #>   bladj:    Branch length adjust alg.  Needs an 'ages' file. #>   comnode:  Find common nodes between two trees of different size. #>   sampleprune: Prunes the phylo for each list of taxa in sample. #>   rndprune: Prunes the phylo [-r n] times, using [-p n] terminals. #>   cleanphy: Prunes `empty' internal nodes (e.g., output from phylomatic) #>   version:  Print software version. #>   help:     This file #>  #> Options: #>   -r INT    Number of randomizations to use [999]. #>   -m INT    Swap method to use with comstruct/swap: [2]. #>               0 = Shuffle phylogeny taxa labels. #>               1 = Sample taxa become random draws from sample pool. #>               2 = Sample taxa become random draws from phylogeny pool. #>               3 = Shuffle sample using independent swap. #>               4 = Shuffle sample using trial swap. #>   -w INT    Number of swaps/trials per run (for independent/trial swap) [1000]. #>   -b INT    Number of burnin swaps/trials (for independent/trial swap) [0]. #>   -f filename   Use this file as the phylogeny file [phylo]. #>   -s filename   Use this file as the sample file [sample]. #>   -t filename   Use this file as the traits file [traits]. #>   -p INT    Number of taxa to include in pruned tree [5]. #>   -n        Add default internal node names (aot) or #>             enable null model testing (comdist/comdistnt) #>   -y        Output phylogeny in `fy` format (selected functions) #>   -e        Suppress output of branch lengths. #>   -a        Use the abundances in the sample file (otherwise just pres/abs). #>   -v        Verbose output of raw MPD/MNTD values (comstruct). #>  phylomatic() #>  #>     ====================================================== #>  #>                      P H Y L O M A T I C #>                 Cam Webb <cwebb@oeb.harvard.edu> #>  #>     ====================================================== #>  #> Usage: phylomatic [-t -f -n -h -l] #>  #> Switches: #>   -t FILENAME use this as the taxa file #>   -f FILENAME use this as the phylo file #>   -n    label all nodes with default names #>   -h    Help information #>   -y    Output a tabular representation of phylogeny #>   -l    Convert all chars in taxa file to lowercase #>

title: aot — ph_aot
text: AOT conducts univariate bivariate tests phylogenetic signal trait correlations, respectively, node-level analyses trait means diversification.

title: aot — ph_aot
code: ph_aot(   traits,   phylo,   randomizations = 999,   trait_contrasts = 1,   ebl_unstconst = FALSE )

title: aot — ph_aot
text: traits (data.frame/character) trait data.frame path traits file. required. See Details. phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required. randomizations (numeric) number randomizations. Default: 999 trait_contrasts (numeric) Specify trait used 'x' variable contrasts. Default: 1 ebl_unstconst (logical) Use equal branch lengths unstandardized contrasts. Default: FALSE

title: aot — ph_aot
text: list data.frames

title: aot — ph_aot
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: aot — ph_aot
text: traits table, passing file, names first column must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: aot — ph_aot
code:
if (FALSE) { traits_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_aot", package = "phylocomr")  # from data.frame traitsdf_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot_df",   package = "phylocomr") traits <- read.table(text = readLines(traitsdf_file), header = TRUE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) (res <- ph_aot(traits, phylo = phylo_str))  # from files traits_str <- paste0(readLines(traits_file), collapse = "
") traits_file2 <- tempfile() cat(traits_str, file = traits_file2, sep = '
') phylo_file2 <- tempfile() cat(phylo_str, file = phylo_file2, sep = '
') (res <- ph_aot(traits_file2, phylo_file2)) }

title: bladj — ph_bladj
text: Bladj take phylogeny fixes root node specified age, fixes nodes might age estimates . sets branch lengths placing nodes evenly dated nodes, dated nodes terminals (beginning longest 'chains').

title: bladj — ph_bladj
code: ph_bladj(ages, phylo)

title: bladj — ph_bladj
text: ages (data.frame/character) ages data.frame, path ages file. required. column names matter, discarded anyway. first column must node names, second column node ages. See Details. phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required.

title: bladj — ph_bladj
text: newick string attributes ages phylo files used stored

title: bladj — ph_bladj
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: bladj — ph_bladj
text: issues aware : ages table must row root node age estimate. bladj work without . attempt check can check pass phylo object; easy way parse newick string without requiring ape bladj case sensitive. internally lowercase tip node labels taxon names ages file avoid case sensitivity problems

title: bladj — ph_bladj
code: if (FALSE) { ages_file <- system.file("examples/ages", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_bladj", package = "phylocomr")  # from data.frame ages_df <- data.frame(   a = c('malpighiales','eudicots','ericales_to_asterales','plantaginaceae',         'malvids', 'poales'),   b = c(81, 20, 56, 76, 47, 71) ) phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) (res <- ph_bladj(ages = ages_df, phylo = phylo_str)) if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   plot(read.tree(text = res)) }  # from files ages_file2 <- file.path(tempdir(), "ages") write.table(ages_df, file = ages_file2, row.names = FALSE,   col.names = FALSE, quote = FALSE) phylo_file2 <- tempfile() cat(phylo_str, file = phylo_file2, sep = '\n') (res <- ph_bladj(ages_file2, phylo_file2)) if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   plot(read.tree(text = res)) }  # using a ape phylo phylogeny object x <- read.tree(text = phylo_str) if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   plot(x) }  (res <- ph_bladj(ages_file2, x)) if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   tree <- read.tree(text = res)   plot(tree) } }

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: Outputs phylogenetic distance samples, based phylogenetic distances taxa one sample taxa

title: comdist — ph_comdist
code: ph_comdist(   sample,   phylo,   rand_test = FALSE,   null_model = 0,   randomizations = 999,   abundance = TRUE )  ph_comdistnt(   sample,   phylo,   rand_test = FALSE,   null_model = 0,   randomizations = 999,   abundance = TRUE )

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: sample (data.frame/character) sample data.frame path sample file phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required. rand_test (logical) want use null models? Default: FALSE null_model (integer) null model use. See Details. randomizations (numeric) number randomizations. Default: 999 abundance (logical) TRUE (default) computed accounting abundance. Otherwise, uses presence-absence.

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: data.frame list data.frame's use null models

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: 0 - Phylogeny shuffle: null model shuffles species labels across entire phylogeny. randomizes phylogenetic relationships among species. 1 - Species sample become random draws sample pool: null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species actually occurring least one sample. Thus, species phylogeny actually observed occur sample included null communities 2 - Species sample become random draws phylogeny pool: null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species phylogeny pool. species phylogeny equal probability included null communities. changing phylogeny, different species pools can simulated. example, phylogeny include species present larger region. 3 - Independent swap: independent swap algorithm (Gotelli Entsminger, 2003); also known ‘SIM9’ (Gotelli, 2000) creates swapped versions sample/species matrix.

title: comdist — ph_comdist
text: sample table, passing file, names third column must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: Calculates mean phylogenetic distance (MPD) mean nearest phylogenetic taxon distance (MNTD; aka MNND) sample, compares MPD/MNTD values randomly generated samples (null communities) phylogenies.

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
code: ph_comstruct(   sample,   phylo,   null_model = 0,   randomizations = 999,   swaps = 1000,   abundance = TRUE )

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: sample (data.frame/character) sample data.frame path sample file phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required. null_model (integer) null model use. See Details. randomizations (numeric) number randomizations. Default: 999 swaps (numeric) number swaps. Default: 1000 abundance (logical) TRUE (default) computed accounting abundance. Otherwise, uses presence-absence.

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: data.frame

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: 0 - Phylogeny shuffle: null model shuffles species labels across entire phylogeny. randomizes phylogenetic relationships among species. 1 - Species sample become random draws sample pool: null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species actually occurring least one sample. Thus, species phylogeny actually observed occur sample included null communities 2 - Species sample become random draws phylogeny pool: null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species phylogeny pool. species phylogeny equal probability included null communities. changing phylogeny, different species pools can simulated. example, phylogeny include species present larger region. 3 - Independent swap: independent swap algorithm (Gotelli Entsminger, 2003); also known ‘SIM9’ (Gotelli, 2000) creates swapped versions sample/species matrix.

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
text: sample table, passing file, names third column must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: comstruct — ph_comstruct
code:
sfile <- system.file("examples/sample_comstruct", package = "phylocomr") pfile <- system.file("examples/phylo_comstruct", package = "phylocomr")  # from data.frame sampledf <- read.table(sfile, header = FALSE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(pfile) (res <- ph_comstruct(sample = sampledf, phylo = phylo_str)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   plot   ntaxa   mpd mpd.rnd mpd.sd    nri mpd.ranklow mpd.rankhi  mntd mntd.rnd #>   <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>       <int>      <int> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 clump1     8  4.25    7.26  0.312  9.63          999          0  2        4.73 #> 2 clump…     8  4.94    7.16  0.326  6.79          999          0  2        4.72 #> 3 clump…     8  5.83    7.17  0.350  3.81          992          7  2        4.72 #> 4 clump4     8  6.94    7.16  0.320  0.687         804        211  2        4.67 #> 5 even       8  7.75    7.28  0.269 -1.75            5        999  6        4.72 #> 6 random     8  7.11    7.03  0.351 -0.236         480        526  4.88     4.70 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: mntd.sd <dbl>, nti <dbl>, mntd.ranklo <int>, #> #   mntd.rankhi <int>, runs <int>  # from files sample_str <- paste0(readLines(sfile), collapse = "
") sfile2 <- tempfile() cat(sample_str, file = sfile2, sep = '
') pfile2 <- tempfile() cat(phylo_str, file = pfile2, sep = '
') (res <- ph_comstruct(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   plot   ntaxa   mpd mpd.rnd mpd.sd    nri mpd.ranklow mpd.rankhi  mntd mntd.rnd #>   <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>       <int>      <int> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 clump1     8  4.25    7.26  0.312  9.63          999          0  2        4.73 #> 2 clump…     8  4.94    7.16  0.326  6.79          999          0  2        4.72 #> 3 clump…     8  5.83    7.17  0.350  3.81          992          7  2        4.72 #> 4 clump4     8  6.94    7.16  0.320  0.687         804        211  2        4.67 #> 5 even       8  7.75    7.28  0.269 -1.75            5        999  6        4.72 #> 6 random     8  7.11    7.03  0.351 -0.236         480        526  4.88     4.70 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: mntd.sd <dbl>, nti <dbl>, mntd.ranklo <int>, #> #   mntd.rankhi <int>, runs <int>  # different null models ph_comstruct(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2, null_model = 0) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   plot   ntaxa   mpd mpd.rnd mpd.sd    nri mpd.ranklow mpd.rankhi  mntd mntd.rnd #>   <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>       <int>      <int> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 clump1     8  4.25    7.26  0.312  9.63          999          0  2        4.73 #> 2 clump…     8  4.94    7.16  0.326  6.79          999          0  2        4.72 #> 3 clump…     8  5.83    7.17  0.350  3.81          992          7  2        4.72 #> 4 clump4     8  6.94    7.16  0.320  0.687         804        211  2        4.67 #> 5 even       8  7.75    7.28  0.269 -1.75            5        999  6        4.72 #> 6 random     8  7.11    7.03  0.351 -0.236         480        526  4.88     4.70 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: mntd.sd <dbl>, nti <dbl>, mntd.ranklo <int>, #> #   mntd.rankhi <int>, runs <int> ph_comstruct(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2, null_model = 1) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   plot   ntaxa   mpd mpd.rnd mpd.sd    nri mpd.ranklow mpd.rankhi  mntd mntd.rnd #>   <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>       <int>      <int> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 clump1     8  4.25    7.07  0.430  6.55          999          0  2        4.52 #> 2 clump…     8  4.94    7.11  0.352  6.15          999          0  2        4.65 #> 3 clump…     8  5.83    7.10  0.356  3.55          993          7  2        4.62 #> 4 clump4     8  6.94    7.09  0.358  0.405         745        278  2        4.65 #> 5 even       8  7.75    7.20  0.325 -1.68            5        999  6        4.62 #> 6 random     8  7.11    6.96  0.373 -0.392         404        606  4.88     4.64 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: mntd.sd <dbl>, nti <dbl>, mntd.ranklo <int>, #> #   mntd.rankhi <int>, runs <int> ph_comstruct(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2, null_model = 2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   plot   ntaxa   mpd mpd.rnd mpd.sd    nri mpd.ranklow mpd.rankhi  mntd mntd.rnd #>   <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>       <int>      <int> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 clump1     8  4.25    7.30  0.273 11.2           999          0  2        4.75 #> 2 clump…     8  4.94    7.15  0.352  6.28          999          0  2        4.73 #> 3 clump…     8  5.83    7.16  0.330  4.02          995          5  2        4.76 #> 4 clump4     8  6.94    7.17  0.315  0.730         825        210  2        4.74 #> 5 even       8  7.75    7.28  0.283 -1.66            3        999  6        4.74 #> 6 random     8  7.11    7.01  0.350 -0.277         476        535  4.88     4.69 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: mntd.sd <dbl>, nti <dbl>, mntd.ranklo <int>, #> #   mntd.rankhi <int>, runs <int> # ph_comstruct(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2, null_model = 3)

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: Calculate measures trait dispersion within community, compare observed patterns expected null model.

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
code: ph_comtrait(   sample,   traits,   binary = NULL,   metric = "variance",   null_model = 0,   randomizations = 999,   abundance = TRUE )

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: sample (data.frame/character) sample data.frame path sample file traits (data.frame/character) traits data.frame path traits file binary (logical) logical vector indicating columns treated binary characters - others treated continuous metric (integer) metric calculate. One variance, mpd, mntd, range (converted phylocom integer format internally) null_model (integer) null model use. See Details. randomizations (numeric) number randomizations. Default: 999 abundance (logical) TRUE (default) computed accounting abundance. Otherwise, uses presence-absence.

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: data.frame form: trait - Trait name sample - Sample name ntaxa - Number taxa sample mean - Mean value trait sample metric - Observed metric sample meanrndmetric - Mean value metric null models sdrndmetric - Standard deviation metric null models sesmetric - Standardized effect size metric ranklow - Number randomizations metric lower observed rankhigh - Number randomizations metric higher observed runs - Number randomizations

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats give data.frame traits parameter expects data.frame like species - taxon labels matching sample data sample parameter col1,col2,col3,etc. - number trait columns - column names matter giving data.frame traits make sure pass binary vector traits treated binary.

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: 0 - null model shuffles trait values across species. 1 - Species sample become random draws sample pool. null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species actually occurring least one sample 2 - Species sample become random draws traits data. null model maintains species richness sample, identities species occurring sample randomized. sample, species drawn without replacement list species trait values. function redundant since definition sample trait species must match, included consistency comstruct function. 3 - Independent swap: ph_comdist ph_comstruct

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
text: sample trait tables, passing file, names third first columns, respectively, must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: comtrait — ph_comtrait
code:
if (FALSE) { sfile <- system.file("examples/sample_comstruct", package = "phylocomr") tfile <- system.file("examples/traits_aot", package = "phylocomr")  # from files sample_str <- paste0(readLines(sfile), collapse = "
") sfile2 <- tempfile() cat(sample_str, file = sfile2, sep = '
')  traits_str <- paste0(readLines(tfile), collapse = "
") tfile2 <- tempfile() cat(traits_str, file = tfile2, sep = '
')  ph_comtrait(sample = sfile2, traits = tfile2)  # from data.frame sampledf <- read.table(sfile, header = FALSE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) traitsdf_file <- system.file("examples/traits_aot_df",   package = "phylocomr") traitsdf <- read.table(text = readLines(traitsdf_file), header = TRUE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) ph_comtrait(sample = sampledf, traits = traitsdf,   binary = c(FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE)) }

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
text: Ecovolve generates phylogeny via random birth death process, generates traits file five randomly evolving, -dependent traits, sample file single sample unit (‘alive’) containing extant members phylogeny.

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
code: ph_ecovolve(   speciation = 0.05,   extinction = 0.01,   time_units = 100,   out_mode = 3,   prob_env = "3211000000",   extant_lineages = FALSE,   only_extant = FALSE,   taper_change = NULL,   competition = FALSE )

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
text: speciation (numeric) Probability speciation per unit time. Default: 0.05 extinction (numeric) Probability extinction per unit time. Default: 0.01 time_units (integer) Time units simulate . Default: 100 out_mode (integer) Output mode (2 = LTT; 3 = newick). Default: 3 prob_env (character) Probability envelope character change. must string 10 integers. Default: 3211000000 extant_lineages (logical) Stop simulation number extant lineages. Default: FALSE only_extant (logical) Output phylogeny pruned extant taxa. Default: FALSE taper_change (numeric/integer) Taper character change e^(-time/F). produces conservatism traits (see Kraft et al., 2007). Default: NULL, passed competition (logical) Simulate competition, trait proximity increasing extinction. Default: FALSE

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
text: list three elements: phylogeny - phylogeny newick string. case out_mode = 2 gives Lineage Time data.frame instead newick phylogeny sample - data.frame three columns, "sample" ("alive"), "abundance" (1's), "name" (species code). case out_mode = 2 gives empty data.frame traits - data.frame first column spcies code ("name"), 5 randomly evolved independent traits. case out_mode = 2 gives empty data.frame

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
text: Two files, "ecovolve.sample" "ecovolve.traits" written current working directory function runs - read files , delete files via unlink

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
text: Function occasionally fails error "call 'ecovolve' failed status 8. 1 taxon; > 1 required" - just means 1 taxon created random process, function proceed

title: ecovolve — ph_ecovolve
code: if (FALSE) { # ph_ecovolve(speciation = 0.05) # ph_ecovolve(speciation = 0.1) # ph_ecovolve(extinction = 0.005) # ph_ecovolve(time_units = 50) # ph_ecovolve(out_mode = 2) # ph_ecovolve(extant_lineages = TRUE) # ph_ecovolve(extant_lineages = FALSE) # ph_ecovolve(only_extant = FALSE) # ph_ecovolve(only_extant = TRUE, speciation = 0.1) # ph_ecovolve(taper_change = 2) # ph_ecovolve(taper_change = 10) # ph_ecovolve(taper_change = 500)  if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   # library(ape)   # x <- ph_ecovolve(speciation = 0.05)   # plot(read.tree(text = x$phylogeny)) }  }

what: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
text: Calculates Faith’s (1992) index phylogenetic diversity (PD) sample phylo.

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
code: ph_pd(sample, phylo)

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
text: sample (data.frame/character) sample data.frame path sample file. required phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required.

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
text: single data.frame, colums: sample - community name/label ntaxa - number taxa pd - Faith's phylogenetic diversity treebl - tree BL proptreebl - proportion tree BL

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
text: sample table, passing file, names third column must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: pd - Faith's index of phylogenetic diversity — ph_pd
code:
sfile <- system.file("examples/sample_comstruct", package = "phylocomr") pfile <- system.file("examples/phylo_comstruct", package = "phylocomr")  # from data.frame sampledf <- read.table(sfile, header = FALSE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(pfile) ph_pd(sample = sampledf, phylo = phylo_str) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   sample  ntaxa    pd treebl proptreebl #>   <chr>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1 clump1      8    16     62      0.258 #> 2 clump2a     8    17     62      0.274 #> 3 clump2b     8    18     62      0.29  #> 4 clump4      8    22     62      0.355 #> 5 even        8    30     62      0.484 #> 6 random      8    27     62      0.435  # from files sample_str <- paste0(readLines(sfile), collapse = "
") sfile2 <- tempfile() cat(sample_str, file = sfile2, sep = '
') pfile2 <- tempfile() phylo_str <- readLines(pfile) cat(phylo_str, file = pfile2, sep = '
')  ph_pd(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   sample  ntaxa    pd treebl proptreebl #>   <chr>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1 clump1      8    16     62      0.258 #> 2 clump2a     8    17     62      0.274 #> 3 clump2b     8    18     62      0.29  #> 4 clump4      8    22     62      0.355 #> 5 even        8    30     62      0.484 #> 6 random      8    27     62      0.435

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
text: Phylomatic tool extracting phylogeny master phylogeny using user-supplied list taxa.

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
code: ph_phylomatic(taxa, phylo, tabular = FALSE, lowercase = FALSE, nodes = FALSE)

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
text: taxa (character) taxa character vector (written temp file provided) - path taxa file. Required. See Details. phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required. tabular (logical) Output tabular representation phylogeny. Default: FALSE lowercase (logical) Convert chars taxa file lowercase. Default: FALSE nodes (logical) label nodes default names. Default: FALSE

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
text: taxa character vector must element form family/genus/genus_epithet. file passed , line family/genus/genus_epithet string - make sure one per line, newline (.e., press ENTER) end line

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
text: Phylomatic also available web service (https://github.com/camwebb/phylomatic-ws) - based different code base (https://github.com/camwebb/phylomatic-ws) See Webb Donoghue (2005) doi:10.1111/j.1471-8286.2004.00829.x  information goals Phylomatic.

title: phylomatic — ph_phylomatic
code: if (FALSE) { taxa_file <- system.file("examples/taxa", package = "phylocomr") phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo", package = "phylocomr")  # from strings (taxa_str <- readLines(taxa_file)) (phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file)) (tree <- ph_phylomatic(taxa = taxa_str, phylo = phylo_str))  # from files taxa_file2 <- tempfile() cat(taxa_str, file = taxa_file2, sep = '\n') phylo_file2 <- tempfile() cat(phylo_str, file = phylo_file2, sep = '\n') (tree <- ph_phylomatic(taxa = taxa_file2, phylo = phylo_file2))  if (requireNamespace("ape")) {   library(ape)   plot(read.tree(text = tree)) } }

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
text: measure within- among-community diversity taking species dissimilarity (phylogenetic dissimilarity) account

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
code: ph_rao(sample, phylo)

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
text: sample (data.frame/character) sample data.frame path sample file phylo (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required.

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
text: list 6 data.frame's: Diversity components: overall alpha (within-site) beta (among-site) total diversity Fst statistic differentiation diversity phylogenetic diversity Within-community diversity: Plot - Plot name NSpp - Number species NIndiv - Number individuals PropIndiv - Proportion individuals found plot D - Diversity (= Simpson’s diversity) Dp - Phylogenetic diversity (= Diversity weighted interspecific phylogenetic distances) remaining 4 tables compare community pairwise: among_community_diversity_d - Among-community diversities among_community_diversity_h - Among-community diversities excluding within-community diversity among_community_phylogenetic_diversity_dp - Among-community phylogenetic diversities among_community_phylogenetic_diversity_hp - Among-community phylogenetic diversities excluding within-community diversity

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
text: See phylocomr-inputs expected input formats

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
text: sample table, passing file, names third column must lowercase; , lowercase . pass data.frame, lowercase . phylo tip/node labels also lowercased avoid casing problems

title: rao - Rao's quadratic entropy — ph_rao
code:
sfile <- system.file("examples/sample_comstruct", package = "phylocomr") pfile <- system.file("examples/phylo_comstruct", package = "phylocomr")  # sample from data.frame, phylogeny from a string sampledf <- read.table(sfile, header = FALSE,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE) phylo_str <- readLines(pfile)  ph_rao(sample = sampledf, phylo = phylo_str) #> $diversity_components #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   component standard phylogenetic #>   <chr>        <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 Alpha       0.860         3.11  #> 2 Beta        0.0848        0.753 #> 3 Total       0.945         3.86  #> 4 Fst         0.0897        0.195 #>  #> $within_community_diveristy #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   plot     nspp nindiv propindiv     d    dp #>   <chr>   <int>  <int>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 clump1      8      8     0.118 0.875  2.12 #> 2 clump2a     8     12     0.176 0.861  2.47 #> 3 clump2b     8     12     0.176 0.861  2.92 #> 4 clump4      8     12     0.176 0.861  3.47 #> 5 even        8      8     0.118 0.875  3.88 #> 6 random      8     16     0.235 0.844  3.55 #>  #> $among_community_diversity_d #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   .          clump1 clump2a clump2b clump4  even random #>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 clump1  8.37e+165   0.958   0.958  0.979 0.969  0.977 #> 2 clump2a 9.58e-  1   0.861   0.972  0.958 0.969  0.984 #> 3 clump2b 9.58e-  1   0.972   0.861  0.931 0.969  0.964 #> 4 clump4  9.79e-  1   0.958   0.931  0.861 0.938  0.964 #> 5 even    9.69e-  1   0.969   0.969  0.938 0.875  0.961 #> 6 random  9.77e-  1   0.984   0.964  0.964 0.961  0.844 #>  #> $among_community_diversity_h #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   .          clump1 clump2a clump2b clump4   even random #>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 clump1  8.37e+165  0.0903  0.0903 0.111  0.0938  0.117 #> 2 clump2a 9.03e-  2  0       0.111  0.0972 0.101   0.132 #> 3 clump2b 9.03e-  2  0.111   0      0.0694 0.101   0.111 #> 4 clump4  1.11e-  1  0.0972  0.0694 0      0.0694  0.111 #> 5 even    9.38e-  2  0.101   0.101  0.0694 0       0.102 #> 6 random  1.17e-  1  0.132   0.111  0.111  0.102   0     #>  #> $among_community_phylogenetic_diversity_dp #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   .       clump1 clump2a clump2b clump4  even random #>   <chr>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 clump1    2.12    3.38    4.04   4.35  4.03   4.02 #> 2 clump2a   3.38    2.47    4.36   4.21  4.03   3.91 #> 3 clump2b   4.04    4.36    2.92   3.68  4.03   3.97 #> 4 clump4    4.35    4.21    3.68   3.47  3.94   4.12 #> 5 even      4.03    4.03    4.03   3.94  3.88   4    #> 6 random    4.02    3.91    3.97   4.12  4      3.55 #>  #> $among_community_phylogenetic_diversity_hp #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   .       clump1 clump2a clump2b clump4  even random #>   <chr>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 clump1    0      1.08    1.52   1.56  1.03   1.18  #> 2 clump2a   1.08   0       1.67   1.24  0.858  0.898 #> 3 clump2b   1.52   1.67    0      0.486 0.635  0.738 #> 4 clump4    1.56   1.24    0.486  0     0.264  0.606 #> 5 even      1.03   0.858   0.635  0.264 0      0.285 #> 6 random    1.18   0.898   0.738  0.606 0.285  0     #>   # both from files sample_str <- paste0(readLines(sfile), collapse = "
") sfile2 <- tempfile() cat(sample_str, file = sfile2, sep = '
') pfile2 <- tempfile() phylo_str <- readLines(pfile) cat(phylo_str, file = pfile2, sep = '
')  ph_rao(sample = sfile2, phylo = pfile2) #> $diversity_components #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   component standard phylogenetic #>   <chr>        <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 Alpha       0.860         3.11  #> 2 Beta        0.0848        0.753 #> 3 Total       0.945         3.86  #> 4 Fst         0.0897        0.195 #>  #> $within_community_diveristy #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   plot     nspp nindiv propindiv     d    dp #>   <chr>   <int>  <int>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 clump1      8      8     0.118 0.875  2.12 #> 2 clump2a     8     12     0.176 0.861  2.47 #> 3 clump2b     8     12     0.176 0.861  2.92 #> 4 clump4      8     12     0.176 0.861  3.47 #> 5 even        8      8     0.118 0.875  3.88 #> 6 random      8     16     0.235 0.844  3.55 #>  #> $among_community_diversity_d #> # title: Expected inputs — phylocomr-inputs
text: Expected inputs

title: Expected inputs — phylocomr-inputs
text: file data.frame, 2 columns: (character) node taxonomic name (numeric) age estimate node file path used, table must headers Applies : ph_bladj()

title: Expected inputs — phylocomr-inputs
text: file data.frame, 3 columns, sorted column 1, one row per taxon: (character) sample plot/quadrat/trap/etc. name (spaces, must begin letter, number symbol) (integer) abundance (leave 1 presence/absence data) (character) species code (phylogeny, must begin letter, number symbol) file path used, table must headers, must tab-delimited Applies : ph_comtrait() ph_comstruct() ph_comdist() ph_pd() ph_rao()

title: Expected inputs — phylocomr-inputs
text: tab-delimited file first line type<TAB>n<TAB>n<TAB>... [number traits], example: type<TAB>3<TAB>3<TAB>3<TAB>0 n indicates type trait four columns. Types: 0: binary (one binary trait may included, must first column) 1 unordered multistate (algorithms currently implemented) 2: ordered multistate (currently treated continuous) 3: continuous Optional: second line can start word name (lower case ) list names traits order. appear full output file Subsequent lines taxon name, must identical appearance phylo, data columns separated tabs. example: sp1<TAB>1<TAB>1<TAB>1<TAB>0 - data.frame, first column called name taxon, followed number columns traits. first column name must name, following columns named using name trait. Applies : ph_comtrait() ph_aot()

title: Expected inputs — phylocomr-inputs
text: Phylocom expects trees Newick format. basic Newick format used Phylocom : ((,B),C);. See Phylocom manual (https://phylodiversity.net/phylocom/) details expect. Applies : functions except ph_phylomatic() ph_ecovolve()

title: Phylocom interface — phylocomr-package
text: phylocomr gives access Phylocom, specifically Phylocom C library (https://github.com/phylocom/phylocom/), licensed BSD 2-clause (http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php)

title: Phylocom interface — phylocomr-package
text: package system calls separately installed Phylocom instance - actually includes Phylocom package. Phylocom usually used either command line R package picante, duplicated Phylocom functionality. terms performance, functionality faster picante, maintainers picante re-written Phylocom functionality C/C++, performance similar cases.

title: Phylocom interface — phylocomr-package
text: convenience can pass ages, sample trait data.frame's, phylogenies strings, phylocomr functions. However, phylocomr write data.frame's/strings disk (computer's file system) able run Phylocom code . Internally, phylocomr writing temporary file run Phylocom code, file removed. addition, can pass files instead data.frame's/strings. used. Instead, read write files temporary files. two reasons. First, Phylocom expects files using directory, control file paths becomes easier. Second, Phylocom case sensitive, simply standardize taxon names lower casing . case manipulation temporary files original data files modified.

title: Phylocom interface — phylocomr-package
text: ecovolve()/ph_ecovolve() - interface ecovolve executable, higher level interface phylomatic()/ph_phylomatic() - interface phylomatic executable, higher level interface phylocom() - interface phylocom executable ph_aot() - higher level interface aot ph_bladj() - higher level interface bladj ph_comdist()/ph_comdistnt() - higher level interface comdist ph_comstruct() - higher level interface comstruct ph_comtrait() - higher level interface comtrait ph_pd() - higher level interface Faith's phylogenetic diversity

title: Phylocom interface — phylocomr-package
text: Scott Chamberlain Jeroen Ooms

title: phylocomr 0.3.0
text: via (#26) (see ) - now longer use file paths passed directly functions, instead write temporary files run Phylocom alter users files. note README package level manual file ?phylocomr package gains new manual file ?phylocomr-inputs details four types inputs functions format expected , including differ passing data.frame’s vs. file paths (#28)

title: phylocomr 0.3.0
text: data.frame traits inputs fxns, check first column called name (Phylocom doesn’t accept anything else) (#27) fix originally ph_aot(), realized touches almost functions: Phylocom case sensitive. already making sure taxon names phylogenies (tips nodes) lowercased, lowercasing names tables passed , fixing case file paths passed user. Now across functions make sure case lowercase taxon names user inputs, case problems longer issue. (#26) via @Jez-R

title: phylocomr 0.2.0
